alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 18 at 4:45AM AKDT until March 19 at 12:00AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO MIDNIGHT AKDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. Areas of blowing snow reducing visibility to one half mile or less at times. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches from Moose Pass south and 10 to 18 inches north of Moose Pass through Turnagain Pass. * WHERE...Western Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to midnight AKDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Travel may be difficult. Visibilities may be severely limited in heavy snowfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain may mix in with the snow especially near Seward and Portage.
info.instruction: A Winter Storm Warning for snow means severe winter weather conditions will make travel very hazardous. If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
